messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] I am not sending my child to school tommorow...
messages.msgSnippet: Congratulations!  After several weeks of serious deschooling, our days are better and better.  Thank you every one too.  lisa ... From: Virginia Chiasson
messages.messageBody:
Congratulations! After several weeks of serious deschooling, our days
are better and better. Thank you every one too. lisa

-----Original Message-----
From: Virginia Chiasson [mailto:silverhuntress@...]
Sent: Thursday, September 19, 2002 1:56 PM
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] I am not sending my child to school
tommorow...

Or any other day ever again. I am not forcing him to get out of bed at
6am...I am not even setting the alarm.

I am not sending my son to school tommorow and I am not going to "MAKE"
him
study either. However, I am going to let him play CIV III because he
loves
it and he is definitely learning something from it. And he will tell me
what
that is just as soon as he is ready to.

I am not going to send my baby to school tommorow because it's counter
productive and because, when I told him this as he was about to tell me
how
he got in trouble for the umpteenth time, I told him he wasn't going
back
and he hugged me so hard that I almost lost my breath. He threw his
knapsack
down and asked if he could watch "The Lion King" for the thousanth time
and
I said yes. We are not on the clock anymore and he did not have ANY
homework
to do... not any ever again.

I am not sending my bright wonderful child to school tommorow, and I
have
everyone here to thank for showing me the forest for the trees and for
helping me find the courage to stand up to my own fears about all of
this.
To Kelly here in SC, for telling me to call you, because you have
listened
and cared. To Maria in GA for mirroring what I was afraid of. Find a
lawyer
and stop those DSS type jerks from harrassing you. To Sandra...I don't
know
how you know all you know but I am glad you do. I have been at your
website
for hours reading. And on and on and on...

I am not sending my child to school tommorow and I am going to go finish
watching "The Lion King".

Brightest Blessings,
Virginia

"Religion is what you do so that others will think well of you.
Spirituality
is what you do so you will think well of yourself." - Silver Nolan


---

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] I am not sending my child to school tommorow...
messages.msgSnippet: ... Hi Virginia, I ve been silently following your story and just had to say CONGRATULATIONS! You ve made the right decision. I share in your joy and elation
messages.messageBody:
>
> I am not sending my child to school tommorow and I am going to go finish
> watching "The Lion King".
>
> Brightest Blessings,
> Virginia
>

Hi Virginia,

I've been silently following your story and just had to say CONGRATULATIONS!
You've made the right decision.
I share in your joy and elation about finally breaking free and living a
happy life with your son from now on. :o)

Karin

Today is the first day of the BEST of your life! - Lyman Mark

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] I am not sending my child to school  tommorow...
messages.msgSnippet: ... Dear Virginia, Your post brought tears of joy to my eyes!!!  I have been reading your posts (and everyone elses , too), and I m SO glad for you and your
messages.messageBody:
At 15:55 9/19/02 -0400, Virginia wrote:
>Or any other day ever again. I am not forcing him to get out of bed at
>6am...I am not even setting the alarm.
>
>I am not sending my son to school tommorow and I am not going to "MAKE" him
>study either. However, I am going to let him play CIV III because he loves
>it and he is definitely learning something from it. And he will tell me what
>that is just as soon as he is ready to.

Dear Virginia,

Your post brought tears of joy to my eyes!!! I have been reading your
posts (and everyone elses', too), and I'm SO glad for you and your baby!

Blessings!

Marji

P.S. These folks are something else, aren't they?!

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] I am not sending my child to school tommorow...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/19/02 1:58:57 PM, silverhuntress@comcast.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/19/02 1:58:57 PM, silverhuntress@... writes:

<< To Sandra...I don't know
how you know all you know but I am glad you do. I have been at your website
for hours reading. >>

Thanks.

I think I know what I know the same way you and your son will know all you
know, by just looking, asking, reading, tying it together, discussing it with
others, trying it out, amending it, adding to it... Have FUN with your son!
Watch videos and put on happy music and make good-smelling food to steam up
the windows, and laugh!!

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] I am not sending my child to school tommorow...
messages.msgSnippet: Wooooooohoooooooooo!!!!!!!! Good for you!!!!  Myranda Or any other day ever again. I am not forcing him to get out of bed at 6am...I am not even
messages.messageBody:
Wooooooohoooooooooo!!!!!!!! Good for you!!!! <standing 0>

Myranda


Or any other day ever again. I am not forcing him to get out of bed at
6am...I am not even setting the alarm.

I am not sending my son to school tommorow and I am not going to "MAKE" him
study either. However, I am going to let him play CIV III because he loves
it and he is definitely learning something from it. And he will tell me what
that is just as soon as he is ready to.

I am not going to send my baby to school tommorow because it's counter
productive and because, when I told him this as he was about to tell me how
he got in trouble for the umpteenth time, I told him he wasn't going back
and he hugged me so hard that I almost lost my breath. He threw his knapsack
down and asked if he could watch "The Lion King" for the thousanth time and
I said yes. We are not on the clock anymore and he did not have ANY homework
to do... not any ever again.

I am not sending my bright wonderful child to school tommorow, and I have
everyone here to thank for showing me the forest for the trees and for
helping me find the courage to stand up to my own fears about all of this.
To Kelly here in SC, for telling me to call you, because you have listened
and cared. To Maria in GA for mirroring what I was afraid of. Find a lawyer
and stop those DSS type jerks from harrassing you. To Sandra...I don't know
how you know all you know but I am glad you do. I have been at your website
for hours reading. And on and on and on...

I am not sending my child to school tommorow and I am going to go finish
watching "The Lion King".

Brightest Blessings,
Virginia

"Religion is what you do so that others will think well of you. Spirituality
is what you do so you will think well of yourself." - Silver Nolan


---

messages.subject: I am not sending my child to school tommorow...
messages.msgSnippet: Or any other day ever again. I am not forcing him to get out of bed at 6am...I am not even setting the alarm. I am not sending my son to school tommorow and I
messages.messageBody:
Or any other day ever again. I am not forcing him to get out of bed at
6am...I am not even setting the alarm.

I am not sending my son to school tommorow and I am not going to "MAKE" him
study either. However, I am going to let him play CIV III because he loves
it and he is definitely learning something from it. And he will tell me what
that is just as soon as he is ready to.

I am not going to send my baby to school tommorow because it's counter
productive and because, when I told him this as he was about to tell me how
he got in trouble for the umpteenth time, I told him he wasn't going back
and he hugged me so hard that I almost lost my breath. He threw his knapsack
down and asked if he could watch "The Lion King" for the thousanth time and
I said yes. We are not on the clock anymore and he did not have ANY homework
to do... not any ever again.

I am not sending my bright wonderful child to school tommorow, and I have
everyone here to thank for showing me the forest for the trees and for
helping me find the courage to stand up to my own fears about all of this.
To Kelly here in SC, for telling me to call you, because you have listened
and cared. To Maria in GA for mirroring what I was afraid of. Find a lawyer
and stop those DSS type jerks from harrassing you. To Sandra...I don't know
how you know all you know but I am glad you do. I have been at your website
for hours reading. And on and on and on...

I am not sending my child to school tommorow and I am going to go finish
watching "The Lion King".

Brightest Blessings,
Virginia

"Religion is what you do so that others will think well of you. Spirituality
is what you do so you will think well of yourself." - Silver Nolan
